sen.j: 観世清孝（かんぜ きよたか、1837年（天保8年） - 1889年（明治22年））とは、シテ方観世流能楽師。
sen.e: Kiyotaka KANZE (1837 - 1889) was Nohgakushi (Noh actor), Kanze-ryu shite-kata (main roles of Kanze school).
Kiyotaka KANZE (1837 - 1889) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Kanze-ryu school.
Kiyotaka KANZE (1837 - 1889) was a Nohgakushi (Noh actor) playing shite (principal roles) of Kanze-ryu school.
He was the 22nd Kanze-ryu soke (the head family of the Kanze school).
He was the 22nd head family of the Kanze-ryu school.
He was the 22nd head family of the Kanze-ryu school.
He called himself Sakon KANZE.
He called himself Sakon KANZE.
He called himself Sakon KANZE.

sen.j: 二十一世宗家観世清長の子。
sen.e: He was a child of Kiyonaga KANZE, the 21st soke (the family head).
He was a child of Kiyonaga KANZE, the 21st head.
He was a child of Kiyonaga KANZE, the 21st head.

sen.j: 1869年、徳川慶喜に随従して静岡に移り住む。
sen.e: In 1869 he follow the lead of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA and moved to Shizuoka.
In 1869 he followed the lead of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA and moved to Shizuoka.
In 1869 he followed the lead of Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA and moved to Shizuoka.

sen.j: その後、東京での能楽再評価の流れに合わせて上京した。
sen.e: After that, he left for the capital in accordance with the trend of re-evaluation of Nohgaku (the art of Noh) in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, he left for the capital in accordance with the trend of re-evaluation of Nohgaku (the art of Noh) in Tokyo.
After that, he left for the capital in accordance with the trend of re-evaluation of Nohgaku (the art of Noh) in Tokyo.

sen.j: この間、初世梅若実、五世観世銕之丞（観世紅雪）らが東京で能の復興に尽力した。
sen.e: During this time, Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, Tetsunojo KANZE, the 5th (Kosetsu KANZE) and others worked hard to restore Noh in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During this time, Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, Tetsunojo KANZE, the fifth (also known as Kosetsu KANZE) and others worked hard to restore Noh in Tokyo.
During this time, Minoru UMEWAKA, the first, Tetsunojo KANZE, the fifth (also known as Kosetsu KANZE) and others worked hard to restore Noh in Tokyo.

sen.j: この為、免状発行権をめぐって紛争が生じ、1921年の梅若流創設となる。
sen.e: Consequently, there arose a conflict over the right of issue of license and it resulted in the foundation of Umewaka-ryu (Umewaka school) in 1921.
sen.cmt: 「免状発行権」は定訳不明です。
sen.e: Consequently, there arose a conflict over the right of issue of license and it resulted in the foundation of Umewaka-ryu school in 1921.
Consequently, there arose a conflict over the right of issue of license and it resulted in the foundation of Umewaka-ryu school in 1921.

sen.j: 長男が二十三世観世清廉。
sen.e: His first son was Kiyokado KANZE, the 23th.
His first son was Kiyokado KANZE, the 23th.
His first son was Kiyokado KANZE, the 23th.

sen.j: 三男元義が六代片山九郎右衛門晋三の養嗣子となり、晋三の娘・光子と結婚した。
sen.e: His third son Motoyoshi became adopted heir of Kuroemon Shinzo KATAYAMA, the 6th and married Mitsuko, a daughter of Shinzo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His third son Motoyoshi became adopted heir of Kuroemon Shinzo KATAYAMA, the sixth, and married Mitsuko, a daughter of Shinzo.
His third son Motoyoshi became adopted heir of Kuroemon Shinzo KATAYAMA, the sixth, and married Mitsuko, a daughter of Shinzo.

sen.j: 後に片山家七代目を継承、七世片山九郎右衛門を名乗る。
sen.e: Later, he succeeded to the seventh head of the Katayama family and called himself Kuroemon KATAYAMA, the 7th.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, he succeeded to the seventh head of the Katayama family and called himself Kuroemon KATAYAMA, the seventh.
Later, he succeeded to the seventh head of the Katayama family and called himself Kuroemon KATAYAMA, the seventh.

sen.j: 義兄にワキ方進藤流最後の宗家十世進藤権之助信啓。
sen.e: His brother-in-law was Gonnosuke Nobuyoshi SHINDO, the 10th and last soke of waki-kata Shindo-ryu (supporting actors of Shindo school).
sen.cmt: 「進藤権之助信啓」の読み方は以下のサイトを参照しました。JLogos | 日外ｱｿｼｴｰﾂ｢CD人物ﾚﾌｧﾚﾝｽ事典 日本編｣ | 江戸時代末期・明治期 | 天保2(1831)年 |【進藤権之助信啓】http://www.jlogos.com/webtoktai/index.html?jid=10881149
sen.e: His brother-in-law was Gonnosuke Nobuyoshi SHINDO, the 10th, who was the last head of waki-kata (supporting actors) of Shindo-ryu school.
His brother-in-law was Gonnosuke Nobuyoshi SHINDO, the 10th, who was the last head of waki-kata (supporting actors) of Shindo-ryu school.
